cards.name: Merbegon, the Insatiable Taxidermist
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Merbegon

This card can attack even if it has not been in play under your control since the start of the turn.

If a character enters play under your control, you may destroy that character. If you do, X is that character's strength and Y is that character's life. You may pick a character. If you do, it gains X strength and Y life this turn.

cards.name: Notion Sickness
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a card you control with an ability in its rules text.

EFFECT: You may use one of the card's abilities. If you do, the effect happens twice instead of once. Destroy the card.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by GooDMaN88 Sometimes the mother of invention is madness.

cards.name: Axeclaw Grandchest
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Grandchest

The top card of your deck is revealed at all times.

While the top card of your deck is revealed, this card gains X strength, where X is the numeric cost of that card.

SHAKE UP
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: Shuffle your deck.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D game mechanic by waiya

cards.name: Community Chest
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Community Chest

At the start of each player's turn, both players may draw a card or play a resource.

If you control at least [D] and choose to put this card on the bottom of your deck as part of your mulligan at the start of a game, you may reveal it. If you do, draw a card at the start of your turn.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D game mechanic by waiya

cards.name: Delicious Strawberry Flavored Death
cards.card-text:
Deplete all non-Rogue characters. Draw a card.

FLIP UP: 1 [D] and your faction loses 5 influence.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by MrJennings ·"I don’t understand it. James Coco went mad in fifteen minutes!·

cards.name: Fornicaves
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Fornicaves

All characters lose X life, where X is their printed life minus 2.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by kallisti This was an actual thing. Look it up.

cards.name: Iohane, the Convex
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Iohane

You may play this card whenever you could play a tactic.

At the start of your turn, flip a coin. If you win, draw a card.

SNEAK
COST: Pay 1.
EFFECT: This card gains Covert this turn.
cards.flavor: hukk! blurp! slosh! …and pose!

cards.name: Ipsighast, the Lustful
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Ipsighast

EXHUMATION
COST: Pay 3. Pick a character in an opponent's discard pile.
EFFECT: Remove that character from the game. This turn, this card gains COVERT. You may put the top 3 cards of that opponent's deck into their discard pile.
cards.flavor: equal opportunity molester

cards.name: Unscrupuls of Victory
cards.card-text: If you control at least [O][O], your opponent discards 1 card. If you control at least [G][G], draw 1 card. If you control at least [E][E], put 1 Micromajig token into play under your control. If you control at least [D][D], search your opponent's deck for 1 card and put it into their discard pile. If you control at least [R][R], you may pick a character. If you do, inflict 2 damage to it.
cards.flavor: i don't think that's a word

cards.name: Giada, the Elegant
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Giada

This card loses 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

If this card would be destroyed by an opposing card or effect, you may put a token on it instead. If you do, deplete it and remove it from combat.
cards.flavor: last Sword to swear allegiance to Padamose Giada's independence was matched only by her grit.

cards.name: Octo-Ba-Ba, the Devourer
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Octo-Ba-Ba

If a character your opponent controls is destroyed, put a token on this card.

DEVOUR
COST: Pay 3. Deplete this card. Remove a token from this card. Pick a character or location.
EFFECT: Inflict 3 damage to the character or location.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by w4r10rd Some historians trace Direstock's cannibalistic culture to Octo-Ba-Ba's influence.

cards.name: Shieldmane Grandchest
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Grandchest

If battle damage is inflicted to a character you control, reduce the amount by 2.

If battle damage is inflicted to a character your opponent controls, increase the amount by 2.
cards.flavor: gory gory hallelujah Venerated by the Marmothoans as a guardian, reviled by their enemies as a destroyer.

cards.name: The Great Wall of Keeping Stuff Out
cards.card-text: If a player plays a tactic, terminate it and inflict 1 damage to this card.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by Sigorion Known by the tribal people as the Shrine of Greanpatoot.

cards.name: The Stone of Triumph
cards.card-text: If a character you control is destroyed, you may pay 1. If you do, search your deck for a card with the same name, reveal it, and put it on top of your deck.
cards.flavor: original Open R&D concept by waiya A half ton of pure popularity.

cards.name: 12 Man Brunch of Doom
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Deplete X characters you control. Pick a character.

EFFECT: If the the picked character has X+X strength or less, destroy it.
cards.flavor: very well sir, human head stuffed with tacos If even one thing is wrong, even the slightest thing, a bad phrase, spilt salt, weak posture, anything at all...the consequences can be horrific. Exploded, melted, turned inside out, consumed by fire, filled with pudding...the 12 Man Brunch has finished many a cocksure arcanist.Werner Geisen, Master Ritualist

cards.name: Air Travel
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: This turn, the character gains Covert. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: to the air!

cards.name: Ambiguity Inhibitor
cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck if you can. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: get a leg up on the pile Thereafter, Ignatius Felnsworth immediately canceled his plans to attend the 6th Annual Deadly Objects Convention.

cards.name: Ameliorate
cards.card-text: Put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck in any order. Put the top X cards of your deck into your hand, where X is the number of cards you put on the bottom plus 1.
cards.flavor: i love the smell of booby in the morning!

cards.name: Arcana Department
cards.card-text: If an attacking or blocking party is formed, it must have an even number of members.
cards.flavor: where suspicion breeds confidence "Take two lefts, an up, and a sidewaysit's the third door on your right.

cards.name: Arcana Experiment
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only if you have at least 5 cards in your deck. Deplete up to 5 characters you control. X is the number of characters you deplete this way.

EFFECT: Search your deck for 5 cards and reveal them. Your opponent chooses X of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your hand and the rest into your discard pile.
cards.flavor: on the cutting edge of compulsion "Stand back, I'm going to try science!

cards.name: Arcanist's Almanac
cards.card-text:
FORESIGHT
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Look at up to the top 5 cards of either deck. Put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: a comprehensive course in absurdity Smarch 5th  Strong voidal storms from the southeast. Wear a bowler hat.

cards.name: Arcanology Recruitment Officer
cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, pick a character your opponent controls. It gains Covert until the start of your next turn.
cards.flavor: a warning and a promise Ladies love a chitinous monstrosity.

cards.name: Ashes of Zenobia
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Ashes of Zenobia

At the start of your turn, draw a card.

NULLIFY
COST: Pay 5.
EFFECT: Both players put a character they control into its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: used to be Pot Roast of Zenobia Until Zenobia left the damn stove on. Again.

cards.name: Cloaked Creeper
cards.card-text:
COVERT

While this card is a member of an attacking party, the party is Covert.
cards.flavor: "try to get to the buffet table Ah, Lord Frothingsloshdont you look...dashing...

cards.name: Deceptive Muddler
cards.card-text:
COVERT

If this card inflicts damage to a faction, your opponent puts a card from their hand on the top of their deck if they can.
cards.flavor: invite him in for a drink and look what happens An Arcanist keeps his things "just so" with good reason. Nothing annoys him more than repositioning.

cards.name: Degenerate Molestation
cards.card-text:
Your opponent cannot respond to this card.

Your opponent discards a card. You may play a non-resource card with numeric cost X or less for free, where X is the numeric cost of the discarded card. (You still need to meet its threshold and satisfy its extra costs.) Repeat this card's effect until your opponent has no cards in their hand.
cards.flavor: giggity giggity

cards.name: Eccentric Inquisition
cards.card-text: Reveal the top 7 cards of your opponent's deck. Remove all tactics revealed this way from the game. Put the remaining cards on the bottom of your opponent's deck in any order. For the rest of the game, you may play tactics removed from the game by this card as though they were in your hand without meeting their threshold.
cards.flavor: [imagine inevitable Spanish Inquisition joke here]

cards.name: Ecto-Distillation
cards.card-text:
COST: Name a card.

EFFECT: Search your deck for any number of copies of the card and reveal them. Put 1 into your hand and the rest into your discard pile. Your opponent may search your deck for any number of copies of the card. If they do, put them into your discard pile.
cards.flavor: complex magical process

cards.name: Ectological Hazard Suit
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

When this card enters play, put a token on the attached character.

The attached character gains 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

HANDOFF
COST: Pay 1. Deplete a character you control that is not in a battle.
EFFECT: Attach this card to the character.
cards.flavor: the old model may be uglier, but at least it works

cards.name: Ectypal Stave
cards.card-text:
COUNTERFEIT
COST: Use this only if a tactic has been played this turn. Pay 2+X, where X is the numeric cost of the last tactic played this turn. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Duplicate the tactic.
cards.flavor: a copy is never as good as the original

cards.name: Eldridge Gosche
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Eldridge

At the start of your turn, you may pick 2 or fewer non-resource cards you control. If you do, put up to 2 tokens divided however you want on those cards.

EJECT
COST: Remove 3 tokens from this card. Pick a non-resource card.
EFFECT: Put the card into its owner's hand.

DISRUPT
COST: Remove 3 tokens from this card.
EFFECT: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card in it. Your opponent discards that card.
cards.flavor: lurid Lugubrian leader

cards.name: Emphatic Ecto-Manipulator
cards.card-text:
COST: You may pick a character you control. 

When this card enters play, if you picked a character as part of its cost, put 2 tokens on that character.
cards.flavor: sinister fondler of voidal boogers Never be the first to put your hand in a viscous fluid.

cards.name: Entangle
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick 2 or fewer characters.

EFFECT: This turn, the characters lose 1 speed. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: ive forgotten who ties up whom

cards.name: Forget
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a non-resource card.

EFFECT: Put the card into its owner's hand. Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card in it. Your opponent discards that card.
cards.flavor: i almost never do that

cards.name: Gargantuan Garbler
cards.card-text:
COVERT

If this card attacks, you may pick a character. If you do, put it into its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: lurkers hate children Ambush by voidal abomination is the leading cause of child mortality in Lugubria. Authorities remain unconcerned.

cards.name: Gnat
cards.card-text: If this card leaves play, your opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: they don't.  but they should. "I told her it was the annotated edition. And she believed me! Now I have to do them all.

cards.name: Insidious Ecto-Manipulator
cards.card-text:
COVERT

At the start of your turn, you may pick a non-resource card you control. If you do, put a token on it.
cards.flavor: twisted master of magical energy

cards.name: Kinky Asp
cards.card-text: COVERT
cards.flavor: like a garden hose, only more bitey Only slightly less deadly than the dreaded bent mamba.

cards.name: Land Shark
cards.card-text:
COVERT

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each face-down resource your opponent controls.
cards.flavor: who is it? Plumber telegram flowers candygram I'm only a dolphin ma'am.

cards.name: Lugubrian Octopod
cards.card-text:
COVERT

If this card inflicts damage to a faction, your opponent discards 2 cards.
cards.flavor: it's watching you

cards.name: Lugubrious Finger Trap
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

The attached character cannot attack or block.
cards.flavor: a tragic opera of moral instruction in five parts O! Cruel Fate! By what loathsome witching have I befallen thus?  The Finger Trap, Act II

cards.name: Maladjustment
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a resource you control. (You can pick face-down resources.)

EFFECT: Put the resource into its owner's hand. You may play a resource.
cards.flavor: just let me put on my face

cards.name: Nearby Serpent
cards.card-text:
COVERT

When this card enters play, look at up to the top 5 cards of either deck. Put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: well, at least im safe

cards.name: Obsessive Compulsion
cards.card-text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may put any number of those cards on the bottom of your deck in any order. Put the remaining cards on the top of your deck in any order. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: a place for everything and everything in its place

cards.name: Odious Diva
cards.card-text:
Your opponent's hand is revealed at all times.

DISAPPROVE
COST: Pay 2. Name a card.
EFFECT: Look at your opponent's hand. Your opponent puts a card with the chosen name on the bottom of their deck if they can. If they do, your opponent draws a card.
cards.flavor: rage!  dsespoir!  vieillesse ennemie! Honestly, Gertrudejust because were out of mustard... Theres no reason to make a scene!

cards.name: Ominous Oozling
cards.card-text: COVERT
cards.flavor: squishing is the last thing youll hear Ms. Clotidia Dowdy, the first female explorer to successfully mount an expedition to the ephemeral North Ridge of Mt. Mulrich, seen here outside Blortingshire Manor a mere four hours before her tragic demise.

cards.name: Quotidian Assassination
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: Put the character into its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: a convenient and cowardly solution When the shattering glass shatters, shatters, the cords are drawn slow, again again again, draw the cords, shatter the glass, draw the cords, shatter the glass, wait, silence, with care. Again

cards.name: Quotidian Ejector
cards.card-text:
This card enters play with 2 tokens on it.

EJECT
COST: Remove 2 tokens from this card. Pick a non-resource card.
EFFECT: Put the card into its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: trivially rejecting whatever he chooses

cards.name: Quotidian Misfire
cards.card-text: This turn, if a card is put into a players hand, put it into their discard pile instead.
cards.flavor: hey, it happens If only Id remembered to turn the knob 17 times instead of 16 and a half!

cards.name: Quotidian Virtuoso
cards.card-text:
DISRUPT
COST: Pay 2. Discard a card. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card in it. Your opponent discards that card.
cards.flavor: and...checkmate Queen to L5 and the tower falls. Your move.

cards.name: Recollection Bazaar
cards.card-text:
RECALL
COST: Pick a resource you control. (You can pick face-down resources.)
EFFECT: Put the resource into it's owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "that time I ate too much pie" is always popular

cards.name: Remember
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a tactic in your discard pile.

EFFECT: Put the tactic into your hand.
cards.flavor: my memory is infallablewhen it works

cards.name: Ritual of the Knob & Pull
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character. X is its strength.

EFFECT: If your opponent controls at least X face-down resources, destroy the character.
cards.flavor: no, no, you're off tempo, Mortimer! "Twist to the left dammit! Don't you remember what happened to Jenkins!?

cards.name: Ritual of the Ominous Urn
cards.card-text: Your opponent discards a card. You may search your deck for a card of the same type as the discarded card and reveal it. If you do, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: pretty damn epic The nameless one twisted his inhuman appendage unspeakably, as an ineffable sound filled the unfathomable, indescribable sky

cards.name: Ritual of the Shattering Teeth
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X.

EFFECT: Look at your opponent's hand and choose X or fewer cards in it. Your opponent discards those cards.
cards.flavor: a painful but effective measure I want you to know, this hurts you more than it hurts me.

cards.name: Rummaging Millipede
cards.card-text:
COVERT

When this card enters play, you may pick a tactic in your discard pile. If you do, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: it's right in front of you, fool! I should have sent the centipede.

cards.name: Servile Centipede
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a tactic and reveal it. If you do, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: your slithering servant

cards.name: Skimping Ecto-Manipulator
cards.card-text:
ENERGIZE
COST: Deplete this card. Pick a non-resource card you control.
EFFECT: Put a token on the card.
cards.flavor: hes paid less, and it shows

cards.name: Sneaking Spitspider
cards.card-text: COVERT
cards.flavor: lurking in the shadows Actually honeywhy dont *you* take care of this one.

cards.name: Sneaky Mansion
cards.card-text: COVERT
cards.flavor: did you hear that? Not a creature was stirring, not even a house.

cards.name: Spontaneous Displacement
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a non-resource card. X is half its numeric cost, rounded up.

EFFECT: Put the card into its owner's hand. You may play a non-resource card with numeric cost X or less for free. (You still need to meet its threshold and satisfy its extra costs.)
cards.flavor: its going to get worse before it gets better Or maybe its just going to get worse.

cards.name: Stolen Inspiration
cards.card-text: Look at your opponents hand and choose a non-resource card in it. Your opponent discards that card. You may play a non-resource card with numeric cost X or less for free, where X is half the numeric cost of the discarded card, rounded up. (You still need to meet its threshold and satisfy its extra costs.)
cards.flavor: i was just thinking that

cards.name: Swarm of Gnats
cards.card-text: When this card enters or leaves play, your opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: in Darkest Lugubria, gnat swats you! Yes, gnats! Vicious, nasty gnats with big, pointy stingers! To stick in your skin! And sting you! And theyll swarm all over you and fly in your face and plug up your nose and bite you in the...what do you mean gnats dont have stingers...?  Millicent Holcroft to General J.G. Blargington III.

cards.name: The Deranger
cards.card-text:
LOBOTOMIZE
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Look at your opponent's hand and choose 2 or fewer non-resource cards in it. Your opponent discards those cards. Your opponent takes control of this card.
cards.flavor: commercial crazyfier

cards.name: Toxic Cultivator
cards.card-text: While you control an even number of characters, reduce the numeric cost of tactics you play by 1, to a minimum of 1.
cards.flavor: this'll show those bastards at the fair! People laugh at my toxic pusgourd. But did they slave for countless hours, rubbing it with fat and feeding it weasel paste?

cards.name: Unnatural Alteration
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only during your turn and not during a battle. Pick a character you control.

EFFECT: Destroy the character if you can. If you do, X is its numeric cost. Search your deck for a character with numeric cost X+3 or less and reveal it. You may play it for free. If you don't, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: nom nom nom

cards.name: Venomous Sacspider
cards.card-text: If this card is destroyed by battle damage, your opponent discards their hand.
cards.flavor: oh, here comes woogums now! As pets they're surprisingly affectionate, but fragile. Slip-ups are always bad news; just a drop of their juice is enough to liquefy a cow.

cards.name: Violating Anomaly
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, look at your opponent's hand and choose a card in it. Your opponent discards that card.

If this card leaves play, you may pick a non-resource card. If you do, put it into its owner's hand. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: i think one got into my pants "I thought I was a goner, but turns out they only wanted my tobaccy.

cards.name: Voidal Interference
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only in response to a card being played. (Playing a resource doesn't count.) 

EFFECT: Terminate the card, but put it into its owner's hand instead of their discard pile. Its owner puts a card from their hand on the top of their deck.
cards.flavor: shiggity shiggity shwa I would say to them, "You want ice cream cone?"and both of them say "Yes.

cards.name: Voidal Nullification Chamber
cards.card-text:
At the start of your turn, you may put a token on this card.

ENERGIZE
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: Put a token on this card.

DISSOLVE
COST: Use this only if there are an even number of characters in play. Remove 4 tokens from this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: Destroy the character.
cards.flavor: key component of ecto-distillation

cards.name: Voidal Observatory
cards.card-text:
At the start of your turn, you may put a token on this card.

ENERGIZE
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: Put a token on this card.

STUDY
COST: Remove 3 tokens from this card.
EFFECT: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: precisely detects irrelevant details

cards.name: Voidal Perversion
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick 2 or fewer non-resource cards.

EFFECT: Put up to 2 tokens divided however you want on the cards. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: keep that up and youre bound to go blind

cards.name: Voidal Poisoning
cards.card-text:
You may remove any number of tokens from cards you control. Use the tokens to generate the following effects any number of times:

1 TOKEN: Pick a character. Inflict 1 damage to it.
2 TOKENS: Draw a card.
2 TOKENS: Your opponent discards a card.
3 TOKENS: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: magical hazard

cards.name: Voidal Replication
cards.card-text:
Your opponent cannot respond to this card.

COST: Play this only if a tactic has been played this turn.

EFFECT: Duplicate the last tactic played this turn.
cards.flavor: corrupting magical experience If you hit a copy of yourself, is it still considered assault?

cards.name: Anesthetizing Opulence
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: Destroy the character. Your opponent draws a card.
cards.flavor: i could get used to this Wasn't I supposed to kill somebody? Ooh! Erotic cakes!

cards.name: Armored Keep
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Armored Keep

You may play this card whenever you could play a tactic.

You do not lose the game because your faction has 0 influence.
cards.flavor: protected store of gold, jewels, and catnip

cards.name: Beatrix Winterbottom
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Beatrix

If you draw any number of cards, increase the amount by 1.

While you have at least 10 cards in your hand, you cannot draw cards.
cards.flavor: aggressive and dominant closer of deals She doesnt care about you, shes just looking at your assets.

cards.name: Brummagem Jewelry
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

When this card enters play, deplete the attached character.

The attached character cannot be restored by its controller's faction's Restore Rule.
cards.flavor: i pity the fool who dont like my jewelry

cards.name: Cash Out
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X.

EFFECT: Draw X+1 cards.
cards.flavor: the best investment he ever made In case of emergency, sell wife.

cards.name: Clandestine Resort
cards.card-text: All your characters gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: ahat last!  more pudding! Every Mau secretly desires their own private island, where the feasts are endless and the beaches are littered with catnip.

cards.name: Class Action Defender
cards.card-text:
If any amount of damage greater than 4 is inflicted to this card, reduce it to 0.

If you are attacked, you may pay 2. If you do, restore this card.
cards.flavor: because corporate giants have rights too "Is that everyone? Okay, your refund is right down that alley

cards.name: Concealed Goon
cards.card-text:
COVERT

When this card enters play, your faction loses 5 influence.
cards.flavor: he blends right in Sure is lucky there arent any goons around. Yep, no goons here. I mean, it would really suck if a goon turned up. That would ruin everything. But, um yeah. No goons.

cards.name: Dandy Day-Trader
cards.flavor: trafficker of metaphysical currency Mortimer made a fortune investing in the gravity IPO. Unfortunately, he lost it all on a rainy day due to a massive overextension in the sunlight market.

cards.name: Downsizing
cards.card-text: Destroy all characters. Your opponents faction gains X influence, where X is the number of characters destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: look busy or you could be next The terms of our severance package ensure a high rate of employee retention.

cards.name: Embezzling Bookkeeper
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, your opponent draws a card.
cards.flavor: your most profitable loss to date I should have hired this guy sooner. I especially like his "employer bonus" program.

cards.name: Entry-Level Employee
cards.card-text:
This card enters play with 2 tokens on it.

This card loses 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

INVEST
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: Remove a token from this card.
cards.flavor: now with 2% less chance of uprising! The default setting is "malinger," but you can reprogram it to "sabotage," "embezzle" or our newest feature, "'hold out for more pay.

cards.name: Erotic Assassin
cards.card-text:
This card cannot be restored by your faction's Restore Rule.

This card can attack only once each turn.

RESTORE
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: Restore this card.
cards.flavor: violent and voluptuous Now theres a wave of destruction thats easy on the eyes.

cards.name: Escrow Office
cards.card-text:
DEPOSIT
COST: Pay 1.
EFFECT: Put a token on this card.

WITHDRAW
COST: Remove all tokens from this card. X is the number of tokens removed this way.
EFFECT: Reduce the next numeric cost you pay this turn by X.
cards.flavor: wow, it really echoes in here

cards.name: Executive Poaching
cards.card-text: Destroy the character your opponent controls with the highest numeric cost. If there is a tie, you decide which character is destroyed.
cards.flavor: get em?  that was your plan? Hes putting for eaglethis is for the entire tournamentOh! He was stolen by a necromorph! Thats got to be disappointing!

cards.name: Extortify
cards.card-text: Your faction gains 8 influence.
cards.flavor: also not actually a word Involuntary donations are a well-established part of Mau social doctrine.

cards.name: First Unified Market of Abstract Secure Theoreticals
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE F.U.M.A.S.T.

Reduce the numeric cost of your faction's abilities by 1, to a minimum of 1.
cards.flavor: massive monetary market A location so ginormous it took three artists to build.

cards.name: Free Trade Agreement
cards.card-text:
At the start of each player's turn, that player chooses one of the following:

OPTION 1: That player may draw a card and their opponent may play a resource.

OPTION 2: That player may play a resource and their opponent may draw a card.

OPTION 3: Both players may draw up to 2 cards.

OPTION 4: Both players may play up to 2 resources.
cards.flavor: favors all, and none

cards.name: Furtive Investor
cards.card-text:
COVERT

This card enters play with 2 tokens on it.

This card loses 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

At the start of your turn, you may pick a non-resource card you control. If you do, remove a token from that card.
cards.flavor: i never invest without an exit strategy

cards.name: Ghostly Auditor
cards.card-text:
While you control only 1 character, this card gains Covert.

If this card inflicts damage to a faction, draw 2 cards.
cards.flavor: balancing your books from beyond the grave You forgot to file form 37-Ohhhhh

cards.name: Gold Summit
cards.card-text: If you draw any number of cards, your faction gains X influence, where X is the number of cards drawn.
cards.flavor: whos your daddy? Randolph von Macavowitz Spitoon III, Ltd. always enjoys showing his money whos boss.

cards.name: Hired Goons
cards.card-text:
COVERT

At the start of your turn, you may pay 2. If you don't, your opponent takes control of this card.
cards.flavor: goons.  hired goons.

cards.name: Irresistible Bribe
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character. X is its strength.

EFFECT: Destroy the character. Your opponents faction gains X influence.
cards.flavor: dissecting moral code with diamond-like precision Drugging the audience? Three month's salary. Bumping off last year's winner? A small fortune. Buying the judge? A king's ransom. The smile on my little girl's face? Priceless.

cards.name: Keen Stratagem
cards.card-text: Search your deck for a staple resource and reveal it. Put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: if you want money, you'll have to pay for it "It is well that the people of the nation do not understand our banking and monetary system, for if they did, I believe there would be a revolution before tomorrow morning.

cards.name: Key Man
cards.card-text: If this card leaves play, draw a card.
cards.flavor: congratulations...you're our 23rd CEO! "Bruno here will uncork the bubbly when you reach altitude.

cards.name: Limited Liability
cards.card-text: This turn, cards can only be destroyed by costs, and all inflicted damage is reduced to 0.
cards.flavor: in the finest print money can buy "Alright, already. There's one for each arm, one for the head and one for the leg. But if you want a new shoehorn you'll have to buy it yourself. What do I look like? The charity department?

cards.name: Mafia Lawyer
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, your faction loses 2 influence.

If this card is destroyed during a battle, your faction gains X influence, where X is the total strength of the opposing party.
cards.flavor: youre not innocent until he says so You have the right to an attorney. If you cannot afford an attorney, Vinny and Brick there will break your kneecaps.

cards.name: Market Oracle
cards.card-text:
INVEST
COST: Deplete this card. Pick a non-resource card you control.
EFFECT: Remove a token from the card.
cards.flavor: signs point to "buy I have a sell order on Empire Impoverishments when the pendulum swings north.

cards.name: Mau Party
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only during your turn.

EFFECT: Draw 5 cards. Your faction gains 2 influence.
cards.flavor: it's not a party until somebody gets devoured After we run them over, we stop the car and eat them.

cards.name: Mau Tough
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, your faction loses 4 influence.
cards.flavor: hell bill you for the blood you got on his suit Well if you really want them dead, I suggest my platinum deal which includes a broken neck, two punctured lungs, a shattered hip, and a free disembowling all administered with the most extravagent bludgeons money can buy!

cards.name: Moneychanger
cards.card-text:
This card loses 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

EXCHANGE
COST: Deplete this card. Put a token on this card.
EFFECT: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: don't forget to wipe your money

cards.name: Mutiny Grant
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character your opponent controls. Your faction loses X influence, where X is the numeric cost of that character.

EFFECT: This turn, take control of the character. Restore it.
cards.flavor: whatever you make, i'll double it

cards.name: Nasty Butler
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, your faction gains 4 influence.
cards.flavor: please wait in the garden, sir Im ending this transmission.  L.G.

cards.name: Overinsured Figurehead
cards.card-text: If this card leaves play, draw 2 cards.
cards.flavor: he used to be so down to earth That new job title has really gone to his head. I don't like how he's always talking down to us these days.

cards.name: Paralegal Prodigy
cards.card-text: All your other "lawyer" characters gain 1 strength and 1 life.
cards.flavor: almost ready for the big time Your Honor, I move for a full dismissal on the basis that the plaintiff is a doody head!

cards.name: Pervasive Bodyguard
cards.card-text:
PROTECT
COST: Pay 1. Pick a character in a party with this card.
EFFECT: This turn, the character gains 1 life.
cards.flavor: keeping a watchful eye Since the Clockman Guard is infamously corrupt. Mau often feel the need to contract private security from their own kind to safeguard their personal interests.

cards.name: Pettifogger
cards.card-text: If this card blocks, destroy it and all members of the attacking party.
cards.flavor: and furthermore Extended articulation of the mandatory invocation of the relevant amendment for incessant objection of forward motion of trial proceeding ad nauseum etc. etc.

cards.name: Postmortem Debenture
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character in your discard pile.

EFFECT: Put the character into your hand.
cards.flavor: secured by corporeal collateral It took Jesse Doverspike 10 years to save the down payment for his funeral. It may take him 100 to pay off the debt.

cards.name: Prudent Thug
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, your faction loses 3 influence.

This card loses 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.

This card can attack only once each turn.

RESTORE
COST: Pay 1. Put a token on this card.
EFFECT: Restore this card.
cards.flavor: graduate from the hard knocks school of negotiation

cards.name: Randolph von Macovawitz Spitoon III, Ltd.
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Randolph

When this card enters play, draw a card.

PAYDAY LOAN
COST: Pay 1. Discard a resource or destroy a resource you control.
EFFECT: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Randolph has acquired the rarified status of "limited liability person," which means he cannot be held responsible for his actions as long as he's acting in his own best interest.

cards.name: Real Estate Auctioneer
cards.card-text:
LIQUIDATE
COST: Pay 2. Discard a card. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Draw 2 cards.
cards.flavor: every home has its flaws "Do I hear 20,000? 20,000 for this lovely home with only a slight human infestation?

cards.name: Recapitulating Apparition
cards.card-text: If this card is put into your discard pile from play, you may pay 1. If you do, put it into play under your control. Deplete it.
cards.flavor: quiet down! Honestly, Frank, just pay for the damn piano already!

cards.name: Red Tape
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: This turn, the character loses 3 strength. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: plentiful and pointless "Forrrmmmssss

cards.name: Reluctant Hiree
cards.card-text:
This card enters play with 3 tokens on it.

This card loses 1 strength for each token on it.

INVEST
COST: Pay X, where X is the number of tokens on this card.
EFFECT: Remove a token from this card.
cards.flavor: i dunnoit's shiny and all, but

cards.name: Repo Man
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may pick a location. If you do, destroy it.
cards.flavor: lackey of predatory lenders Your dog is 17 bowls of kibble overdue on his mortgage.

cards.name: Resurrection Technician
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may pick a character in your discard pile. If you do, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor:
looks like the soup du jour was *him*, har har My God! Thats the chairman of Empire Impoverishments! Doesnt he realize hell return as a necromorph?
Its what the will says. Pull the lever, Max.

cards.name: Revivatate
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only during your turn. Pick 2 characters in your discard pile.

EFFECT: Put 1 of the characters into play under your control. Put the other character into your hand.
cards.flavor: almost actually a word In Clockman, they used to have a saying, Only two things are certain in life: death and taxes. Then the Mau arrived.

cards.name: Samuel Gristwalter
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Samuel

Reduce all damage inflicted to your faction to 0.
cards.flavor: every law has its price and you get what you pay for.

cards.name: Secret Handshake
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: This turn, the character gains 4 life. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: its secrecy is exceeded only by its overtness

cards.name: Shocking Reappearance
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only while you are being attacked. Pick a character in your discard pile.

EFFECT: Put the character into play under your control as a member of the blocking party.
cards.flavor: allow me to speak posthumously Moving on to the subject of our former chairmans unfortunate demiseGreat Scott! Our former chairman!

cards.name: Smear Campaign
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

If the attached character inflicts damage, inflict the same amount of damage to the character's controller's faction.
cards.flavor: eat them?  no, I waskissing themwith a fork. Despite his moderate populist stance on foreign policy and the sarcophyle problem, Senator Tysonburg's penchant for babymeat proved too much for voters to stomach.

cards.name: Snooty Doorman
cards.card-text:
DENIED!
COST: Use this only in response to a character being played. Destroy this card.
EFFECT: Terminate the character.
cards.flavor: oh, i'm sorry sir "you're just not our kind of people.

cards.name: Subsection 5, Paragraph 12
cards.card-text:
Your opponent cannot respond to this card.

COST: Play this only in response to an ability thats source was not a faction.

EFFECT: Terminate the ability. It cannot be used again this turn. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: that's the one with the monster in it

cards.name: Summary Judgment
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character your opponent controls. X is its strength.

EFFECT: Your opponent may destroy the character. If they don't, draw X cards.
cards.flavor: pay your fine to the clerk downstairs

cards.name: Tad Disingenuous
cards.card-text:
UNDERHANDED DEAL
COST: Discard a card.
EFFECT: This turn, this card gains Covert.
cards.flavor: hey, judge-baby, you look ravishing!  rrrrowr! "I don't use the word 'hero' very often, but you sirare the greatest hero in Mau history.

cards.name: Tax Attorney
cards.card-text: If your faction loses influence, reduce the amount by 1.
cards.flavor: ingenious protector of assets What, this? Just some old junk Mr. Padamose purchased on debt and leased back to his holding company for a convertible note secured against funds owed for consultations with his subsidiarys equity partners offshore capital advisory firm. Minus out the cost of maintenance, depreciation and interest and its a crushing loss. Hes just a poor old Mau with nothing to call his own but liens, liabilities and a spider or two.

cards.name: The Garbageman
cards.card-text:
This card can attack only once each turn.

SIFT
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Draw a card. Discard a card.

RUMMAGE
COST: Pay 2. Remove 3 cards in your discard pile from the game.
EFFECT: Restore this card.
cards.flavor: well, looky here!  come to papa, baby! "shake the plastic bag and do the twisty thing they dothe garbageman! Ohhh, the garbageman can!

cards.name: The Ministry of Other Smaller Ministries
cards.card-text: Your opponent must pay 2 to attack.
cards.flavor: I told you to stop putting your departments on my side of the table!

cards.name: Union Leader
cards.flavor: creator of the 7-day weekend Hey! You cant lift that pillow! You need a Union Lifter, and a Union Lifter Assistant, Union Pillow Management, Union Pillow Fluffier

cards.name: Writ of Reclamation
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X that is 3 or less. Remove X cards in your discard pile from the game. Pick X other cards in your discard pile.

EFFECT: Shuffle the other cards into your deck. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: i don't care where you took it, it's still mine! "and said thieves shall return the property to its original foundation, at their own expense.

cards.name: 0p3r4710n 1337 H4x0rz
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only during your turn.

EFFECT: You may play up to 4 non-tactic cards for free. (You still need to meet its threshold and satisfy its extra costs.)
cards.flavor: been outside lately? "No. Now go awaywe are playing for the title of Ch4mp10n 0f teh Un1v3r53.

cards.card-text: Reduce the numeric cost of the next card you play this turn by 4. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: m4d.sk1llz

cards.name: 3p1ph4ny 31f
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may play a non-tactic card for free. If you do, your opponent may do the same. (You still need to meet its threshold and satisfy its extra costs.)
cards.flavor: thinks of something clever almost every day Hes been in that epiphany booth an awfully long time

cards.name: 4p7 31f
cards.card-text:
If you play a "gear" card attached to this card, you may detach a resource from your faction.

While a "gear" card is attached to this card, it gains 1 strength and 1 life.
cards.flavor: 1337 700L h4ndL1ng sk1llz Also nunchuck sk1llz, b0whun71ng sk1llz, c0mpu73r h4ck1ng sk1llz

cards.name: 633fy 31f
cards.card-text: COST: Play this only if you have played at least 2 other non-resource cards this turn.

cards.name: 700160x 31f
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a "gear" card with numeric cost 5 or less and reveal it. If you do, put it into play attached to this card.

cards.name: A Series of Tubes
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Series of Tubes

REDIRECT
COST: Pick a "node" character.
EFFECT: This turn, the next 1 damage inflicted to the character is inflicted to this card instead.

All other "node" characters gain 1 strength and 1 life.

When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a "node" card and reveal it. If you do, put it into your hand.

If this card is destroyed, destroy all other "node" cards.
cards.flavor: its not a big truck

cards.name: Acuminous Gigantitect
cards.card-text:
GRAND DESIGN
COST: Pay 2. Discard a card. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Reduce the next numeric cost you pay this turn by 6.
cards.flavor: ants!  you all look like little, tiny ANTS! "hahahahaha! Smush you!

cards.name: All-Nighter
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only during your turn.

EFFECT: Detach up to 9 resources from your faction.
cards.flavor: the dawn is your enemy Isnt it a little bit late in the game to be making changes? You should have worked smarter, not harder. If only you had planned better...now get off your lazy ass and help us move this furniture!

cards.name: Basic Node
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a "node" card and reveal it. If you do, put it into your hand.

If this card is destroyed, destroy all other "node" cards.
cards.flavor: you knowfor n00bz

cards.name: Contriving Engineer
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a card named "Elitism" and reveal it. If you do, put it into play. Attach it to your faction.
cards.flavor: now raise your left hand "Now pull the other 31f's trunks off. Yes, just like that. Good.

cards.name: Discommodiousness
cards.card-text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Shuffle all tactics revealed this way into their deck. Your opponent draws X cards, where X is the number of tactics shuffled into their deck. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: not actually a word Bad news, the Clockman Arcanology branch canceled the rest of their order of toiletmajigs... no, I cant imagine why.

cards.name: Elite Team Registration
cards.card-text: Search your deck for up to 2 Gearsmith characters with different names and reveal them. Put them into your hand.
cards.flavor: |\|0 |\|0065 4110\/\/3|) The game tournaments of Acrolos are legendary in their frivolity and ferocity.

cards.name: Epiphany Ball
cards.card-text:
SUDDEN INSIGHT
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Search your deck for a card. Put it into your hand. Your opponent takes control of this card.
cards.flavor:
the answer just hit me!  (hold for laughter) Thanks folksI'll be here all night!
<applause>

cards.name: Exploding Sock Puppet!
cards.card-text:
Your opponent cannot respond to this card.

COST: Play this only in response to a character's ability.

EFFECT: Terminate the ability. Destroy the character.
cards.flavor: taxi apple sponge! Skunks playing poker, basketball cheesesteak!

cards.name: Gigamajig
cards.flavor: that must be a deep bay You cannot defeat the Gigamajig. You can only hope to contain him.

cards.name: Guardforce Alpha Prime 31f
cards.card-text: This card can attack even if it has not been in play under your control since the start of the turn.
cards.flavor: i select you! "You are my monster selection!

cards.name: Guardforce Alpha Prime H4x0r
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Guardforce Alpha Prime H4x0r

This card can attack even if it has not been in play under your control since the start of the turn.

If this card inflicts damage to a faction, you may play a resource.

cards.name: Guardforce Morphmajig
cards.card-text:
This card can attack even if it has not been in play under your control since the start of the turn.

If you play a card, put a token on this card. (Playing a resource doesn't count.) 

If your opponent plays a card, remove a token from this card. (Playing a resource doesn't count.) 

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.
cards.flavor: it looks angry!  what's it saying? "3xC|_|z3 |\/|3 |=1n3 51rz, \/\/0u1|) j00 m1|\|d 573pp1|\|g 0|_|7 0f 73h 60g?

cards.name: Heavy Plating
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

When this card enters play, you may detach up to 2 resources from your faction.

The attached character gains 4 strength, 4 life, and loses 1 speed.

HANDOFF
COST: Pay 5. Deplete a character you control that is not in a battle.
EFFECT: Attach this card to the character.
cards.flavor: oh boy...sleep!  that's where i'm a viking!

cards.name: Hidden Sandwich
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

You may play this card whenever you could play a tactic.

If the attached character is destroyed, destroy this card instead. Reduce the amount of damage inflicted to the character this turn to 0.
cards.flavor: forged from the remains of lesser sandwiches Never underestimate the deflective powers of pumpernickel.

cards.name: Horsemajig of the Apocalypse - Death
cards.card-text: All other "horsemajig" characters gain 1 strength, 1 life, and 1 speed.
cards.flavor:
just find the strength, among them all, thats higher than its friends.
you put them all, beside themselves, and youll have passed the test!
then each majig, beyond the first, youll need to add once more.
then you should be, proud of yourself, your mind you had to flex!

cards.name: Horsemajig of the Apocalypse - Famine
cards.card-text: All other "horsemajig" characters gain 1 speed.
cards.flavor:
When all you have, is one of each, youll see the way they blend,
And when you find, the numbers that, were greater than the rest,
At first you need, to do the steps, I talked about before,
Now if you solved, the mystery, behind this flavor text,

cards.name: Horsemajig of the Apocalypse - Pestilence
cards.card-text: All other "horsemajig" characters gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
to find their stats, can seem quite hard, tis easy as can be!
for then youll know, once and for all, the horsemajigs true size.
theres one of each, no more no less, so follow me again!
then add the rest, youll have their stats, decipherment galore!

cards.name: Horsemajig of the Apocalypse - War
cards.card-text: All other "horsemajig" characters gain 1 strength.
cards.flavor:
The horsemajigs, they thrive in groups, as you will come to see,
Then do the same, for life and speed, to try this out is wise,
But wait theres more, you are not done, this only works out when,
So if you have, them side by side, theyll start as two three four,

cards.name: Hub Node
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, you may search your deck for a "node" card and reveal it. If you do, put it into your hand.

If this card is destroyed, destroy all other "node" cards.

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each other "node" card in play.
cards.flavor: n00b tested, 1337 approved

cards.name: Invent
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X.

EFFECT: Search your deck for X-1 cards. Put them into your hand.
cards.flavor: thats the best one of those Ive ever seen

cards.name: Jacque's Trap
cards.card-text:
IT'S A TRAP!
COST: Destroy this card. Pick an attacking character.
EFFECT: Destroy the character.
cards.flavor: you know.  it's funny.  get it? I still dont get it. Why is his crotch exploding? And whos that French guy?

cards.name: Jo Ciendeilio
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Jo

RESEARCH
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Reduce the next numeric cost you pay this turn by 3.
cards.flavor: good thing she didnt take after her brother

cards.name: Kaiser Wave
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: This turn, the character gains 1 strength and 1 life. It gains an additional 1 strength and 1 life for each "kaiser" card in play. It gains an additional 1 strength and 1 life if it is a "kaiser" character.
cards.flavor: behold the kaiser ultimate attack!

cards.name: LeoKaiser
cards.card-text:
GO MEGA-NEKO-KAISER!
COST: Deplete a card named "PantherKaiser" you control. Deplete a card named "TigerKaiser" you control.
EFFECT: This turn, this card gains 8 strength, 8 life, and 2 speed and while it is the only member of an attacking party, only parties with at least 3 members can block it.
cards.flavor: meow

cards.name: Luteoderm Goliath
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

The attached character gains 11 strength and 11 life.

HANDOFF
COST: Pay 6. Deplete a character you control that is not in a battle.
EFFECT: Attach this card to the character.
cards.flavor: i always hated that clock tower Immediately destroyed if your opponent plays Luteoderm David.

cards.name: Luteoderm Prototype
cards.card-text:
ATTACH to Character

The attached character gains 1 strength and 1 life.

If the attached character leaves play, you may search your deck for a card. If you do, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: at least we learned what not to do "Any volunteers?

cards.name: Manifold Quasi-Modal Steamwork
cards.flavor: he was so nice.  kept to himself mostly. Our manifold quasi-modal steamwork just hasnt been the same since that dancing gypsymajig showed up.  Great Mecha-Arcanist Frollo

cards.name: Micromajig Avalanche
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X.

EFFECT: Put X Micromajig tokens into play. 

(Treat Micromajig tokens as Gearsmith character cards with 1 strength, 1 life, 3 speed, and the "majig" subtype. If a Micromajig token leaves play, it disappears.)
cards.flavor: cute and crushing

cards.name: Micromajig Maker
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, you may put a Micromajig token into play.

(Treat Micromajig tokens as Gearsmith character cards with 1 strength, 1 life, 3 speed, and the "majig" subtype. If a Micromajig token leaves play, it disappears.)
cards.flavor: the little ones nag the loudest

cards.name: Micromajig Master
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, you may put 2 Micromajig tokens into play.

TINY SACRIFICES
COST: Destroy 3 Micromajig tokens you control.
EFFECT: Search your deck for a card. Put it into your hand.

(Treat Micromajig tokens as Gearsmith character cards with 1 strength, 1 life, 3 speed, and the "majig" subtype. If a Micromajig token leaves play, it disappears.)
cards.flavor: your tiny sacrifices will save us all!

cards.name: Micromajig Shipping Container
cards.card-text:
If this card is destroyed, put 5 Micromajig tokens into play under your control.

(Treat Micromajig tokens as Gearsmith character cards with 1 strength, 1 life, 3 speed, and the "majig" subtype. If a Micromajig token leaves play, it disappears.)
cards.flavor: s&h extra (schproingmajig not included)

cards.name: Omnidirectional Patrolmajig
cards.card-text: If you are attacked, you may restore this card.
cards.flavor: vigilant verifier of veracity The inventors of Acrolos have several campuses on mainland Metatropea. Security is of the highest concern.

cards.name: One-Legged Hopping Pogo-Bear
cards.card-text:
RAAR!
COST: Pay 2.
EFFECT: This turn, this card gains the "character" type and has 3 strength, 3 life, and 3 speed.

SCHPROING!
COST: Use this only during your turn. Pay 2.
EFFECT: If this card is a character, it gains Covert.

HIDE!
COST: Pay 1.
EFFECT: If this card is a character, it loses the "character" type. Deplete this card.
cards.flavor: terrifyingly silly

cards.name: PantherKaiser
cards.card-text:
PANTHER SHIELD
COST: Pay 2. Deplete this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: This turn, the character gains 3 life.
cards.flavor: the left flank of kaiser justice "If you need me, I'll be outside sitting on a stump or something.

cards.name: Patent Enforcement
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only in response to an item being played. Pay X, where X is its numeric cost.

EFFECT: The item enters play under your control.
cards.flavor: stop!  imposter!  i already invented that! "That, too! And that!

cards.name: Precise Sabotage
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick an item.

EFFECT: Destroy the item.
cards.flavor: and they said itd be useless

cards.name: Research Investment
cards.card-text: Both players may search their deck for up to 3 staple resources and put them into play.
cards.flavor: not quite as much as last time After we invented the autoerotic pleasuremajig, the moneybags upstairs decided we were having a little too much fun!

cards.name: Runic Cannon
cards.card-text:
LOAD
COST: Pay 3.
EFFECT: Put a token on this card.

FIRE
COST: Deplete this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: Inflict X damage to the character, where X is the number of tokens on this card. Remove all tokens from this card.
cards.flavor: i dont care how much it costskill it!

cards.name: Runic Circuitry
cards.card-text:
This card enters play with 2 tokens on it.

CONSTRUCT
COST: Pay 3. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Remove a token from this card.

POWER-UP
COST: Use this only if there are no tokens on this card. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Reduce the next numeric cost you pay this turn by 3

cards.name: Auction House
cards.card-text: At the start of each players turn, that player reveals cards from the top of their deck until a character is revealed or no cards are left. If a character is revealed, players take turns bidding on the character (starting with the active player). Players cannot bid a number greater than the number of detached resources they control. Whichever player makes the winning bid pays that many resources and puts the character into play under their control. Shuffle all other revealed cards into their owners deck.
cards.flavor: get 'em while they're tasty!

cards.name: Befuddling Beggar
cards.card-text:
PANHANDLE

EFFECT: This turn, the character either gains or loses 1 speed.
cards.flavor: stench so thick you can chew it

cards.name: Bipolar Sarcophyle
cards.card-text:
When this card enters play, flip a coin. If you win, put a token on this card.

cards.name: Clockman Pickpocket

While your opponent controls an item, this card cannot be blocked.

cards.flavor: you can always count on Dick for a surprise! Damn...I can't find the third rooster. I'll just have to improvise

cards.name: Counter Attack

COST: Play this only during your opponent's turn and not during a battle.

cards.name: Cute Cutpurse
cards.card-text:
While your opponent controls an item, this card cannot be blocked.

If this card inflicts damage to a faction, pick an item your opponent controls if you can. If you do, destroy it.

cards.flavor: talk to the hand I almost hope he doesnt go away. Its been a few hours since Ive kicked someones ass.

cards.name: Early Retirement

EFFECT: Draw X cards.
cards.flavor: doing the bull dance, feeling the flow, working it "Oh, Seor John! You are hairy like beast!

cards.name: Entrancing Harlot

cards.flavor: id hit that She keeps taking them up there, but Ive yet to see anyone come down.

cards.name: Epic Turncoat Maneuver
cards.card-text:
COST: Destroy 2 characters you control. Pick 4 or fewer characters.

EFFECT: Take control of the picked characters.
cards.flavor: curse your sudden but inevitable betrayal! Hed be such a good Lieutenant if hed just stop stabbing us!

cards.name: Face in the Crowd
cards.card-text: While your opponent controls at least 4 characters, this card cannot be blocked.
cards.flavor: blends right in Three hundred bystanders. Not a single witness.

cards.name: Ferrous Ferret
cards.card-text:
Anything that can pick this card must pick it. (This effect is only active while this card is in play.)

If this card is picked, put a token on it.

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.
cards.flavor: mans best (and worst) friend They say ferrets are the highest tier of weapon. What is beyond the ferret tier? A vast, great white nothingness.

cards.name: Fool's Gold
cards.card-text:
TRADE
COST: Pick an item your opponent controls. Pay X, where X is its numeric cost. Destroy this card.
EFFECT: Take control of the item.
cards.flavor: it's something for an executive "'Scuse me, my good man, I have five hundred dollars to blow. What've you got?

EFFECT: The character enters play under your control.
cards.flavor: putting the "sensual" back in "non-consensual Bored with her pallid harem, the sarcophyle mistress is always hungry for handsome new playthings.

cards.name: Grand Theft All
cards.card-text: Put up to 4 non-tactic cards in your opponent's discard pile into play under your control.
cards.flavor: should have locked the door

cards.name: Hangdog Alley
cards.card-text: If an attacking party is formed, it must have only 1 member.
cards.flavor: refuge of outcasts Its confusing design and plentiful exits make Hangdog Alley the perfect retreat for those wishing to avoid the law. Justice is handled by the locals and traitors are dealt with swiftly.

cards.name: Hasty Sarcophyle
cards.flavor: he's hasty.  and a sarcophyle. Man, that is one hasty sarcophyle. Whoosh.

cards.name: Headlong Purloiner
cards.flavor: you brought the woman too?  bonus! The great thing about Randy is that he really throws himself into whatever he does.

cards.name: Heist Planner
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, you may search your opponent's deck for up to 3 cards with different names and reveal them. If you do, put them into your opponent's discard pile.
cards.flavor: so cunning you could brush your teeth with it You throw the paintings out of the window and well run by and pick them up.

cards.name: Hollow Moose

At the start of your turn, your faction loses 1 influence.

INFILTRATE

cards.flavor: i think it's about a moose that turns invisible and goes back in time for some reason.

cards.name: Hulking Vigilante
cards.card-text: If you control any other characters you own, destroy this card.
cards.flavor:
distributor of pain I am the terror that stalks in the street.
I am the dragon that lives in the slums.
I am the ogre that hammers the lawless.
I am the last thing you'll ever see.

cards.name: Hyperphagic Sarcophyle
cards.card-text:
If this card inflicts damage to a faction, you may put a token on it.

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.
cards.flavor: bottomless glutton of blood The suave sarcophyle we know in society is a myth; if our young people really understood what these monsters become, if they could see the wake of tragedy and despair, they would never seek to convert.  Ernest Arndell, A Cancer in our Midst: On Sarcophelia and the Coming Plague

cards.name: Impeccable Timing
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a depleted character. 

EFFECT: If the character has 4 life or less, destroy it.
cards.flavor: i'm sorry sandwich! This happens more often than you'd think.

cards.name: Impulsive Abductress
cards.card-text:
KIDNAP
COST: Destroy this card. Pick an attacking or blocking character.
EFFECT: Destroy the character.
cards.flavor:
take me!  take me! A hearty lass, she sailed the seas 
A queen of all things nautical
She snatched up men with wanton ease 
Wheneer she felt erotical

cards.card-text:

HANDOFF

If a coin is flipped, you may put a token on this card.

You may play this card whenever you could play a tactic.

When this card enters play, you may pick a character. If you do, it gains 1 strength and 1 life this turn.
cards.flavor: who keeps a bird in a treasure chest? Honestly. A bird in a treasure chest.

cards.flavor: dashing seeker of danger

You may use abilities on your opponents cards, but you must pay any numeric cost with your own resources. Any additional costs must be satisfied as though your opponent is using the ability. The abilitys effect happens as if your opponent used it.

CHANGE COSTUME

COST: Discard a character or item. X is its numeric cost.

This card enters play with X tokens on it.

This card gains 1 strength and 1 life for each token on it.
cards.flavor: it's good to be the king

cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, both players put the top 2 cards of their deck into their discard pile.

cards.name: Wild Boars
cards.card-text: While this card is the only member of an attacking party, only characters with at least X speed can block it, where X is this card's speed.
cards.flavor: freshly summoned from the abyss "We should have ordered the chicken!

cards.name: Yoink!
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a "gear" card. Pick a character.

EFFECT: Take control of the "gear" card. Attach it to the character.
cards.flavor: haugh haugh!

cards.name: Arena Quarter-Finalist
cards.flavor: its hard damn work being this good Any rookie can swing a sword; mastery is about keeping your footing when the ring is thick with gore.

cards.name: Assimilation Center
cards.card-text:
"RECRUIT"
COST: Pay 1. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Search your deck for a character and reveal it. Put it on the top of your deck.
cards.flavor: these are lost drunken men who don't care "And these are lost drunken men who do care! And these are men who aren't lost and care, but don't drink.

cards.name: Barbaric Rifleman
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, inflict 1 damage to your opponent's faction.
cards.flavor: batter up! Every winter, the Imperial and Counter-Imperial armies compete against each other in the Metatropean Headball Championship Series. The amount of trash talk is unbelievable.

cards.name: Bask Bile
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character or faction.

EFFECT: Inflict 5 damage to the character or faction.
cards.flavor: for the melting of troops and stuff Available in french onion, barbeque ranch, or original nacho cheese flavor.

cards.name: Berserker Corps
cards.card-text:
This card gains 1 strength for each token on it.

At the start of your turn, you may pick a character you control. If you do, destroy it. Put X tokens on this card, where X is the destroyed character's strength when it was destroyed. Otherwise, destroy this card.
cards.flavor: shhhthe screaming arouses them Got juice?

cards.name: Bladefist Doomwing
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Bladefist

FIREBREATHING
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X. Deplete this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: Inflict X damage to the character.
cards.flavor: Big McLargehuge was already taken Disciplining a barduse requires nerves of steel. A flame-retardant uniform comes in handy, too.

cards.name: Bloodcurdling Bulldozer
cards.card-text: If this card attacks, you may pick a character. If you do, deplete it.
cards.flavor: as scary as he thinks he is OHHH YEEEAAHHH!!!  K.M.

cards.name: Blow Up
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick an item.

EFFECT: Destroy the item. Your opponent's faction loses 3 influence.
cards.flavor: and boom goes the dynamite

cards.name: Callow Liegeman
cards.card-text: If this card attacks in a party with more than 1 member, it gains 1 strength and 1 life this turn.
cards.flavor: hazing?  do your worst. You know if you stab a man in the dead of winter, steam will rise up from the wounds.

cards.name: Crazed Deputy
cards.card-text: If this card is blocked, it gains 2 strength and 2 life this turn.
cards.flavor: a tad unstable What do you mean my shoulder pads make me look like a dandy? RAR! blargity blarg BLARGH!

cards.name: Creaky Old Swordsman
cards.flavor: im getting too old for this shit ...he says if I dont grease him up first he just cant seem to get into it...

cards.name: Deadly Striker
cards.card-text: If this card is destroyed, your opponent's faction loses 4 influence.
cards.flavor:
rock you like a hurricane Dear Sir or Madam:

The Imperial Army regrets to inform you that your son(s) are dead because they got blowed up. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Best wishes,
Praxis, Grand General of Bad Death Stuff

cards.name: Dethmurderbludgeon, the Craghammer
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Dethmrderbldgeon

ATTACH to Character

The attached character gains 2 strength and 2 life.

If the attached character is blocked, your opponent's faction loses 2 influence.

If the attached character inflicts damage to a faction, you may pick a character. If you do, inflict 2 damage to it.

If this card is put into a discard pile from play, put it into its owners hand instead.

cards.name: Dragon Catheter
cards.card-text:
At the start of your turn, put a token on the character with the highest strength. If there is a tie, you decide which character gets the token.

All characters gain 1 strength for each token on them.
cards.flavor: it's disturbingly comfortable Well at least our job is better than the guys who have to clean up.

cards.name: Dragon Juice
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: This turn, the character gains 5 strength.
cards.flavor: what did you think the catheter was for?

cards.name: Dragon Rider

cards.flavor: commanding from above A dragon and his rider are peers. The rider rides at the will of the dragon. They are the captains of the field, circling the battle, landing only to deliver punishment where needed.

cards.name: Dragon Tank
cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, you may pick a character your opponent controls. If you do, destroy it. Otherwise, destroy this card.
cards.flavor: delivers the biggest beatings ever Pulled into battle by mighty basks, the dragon tank is feared above all else. Even if its victims can disable the enormous machinery, the basks remain to spew their acidic venom in an annihilating torrent of pain.

cards.name: Dragon's Quarters
cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, you may pick a character. If you do, this card inflicts X+1 damage to it, where X is the number of "dragon" cards you control.
cards.flavor: dragonomically designed Excuse me?Is this barracks handicap acceOh no! ARGH! NO! <blumph> <mumph> crunch, crunch, crunch, crunch, munchgulp<BURP>

cards.name: Elbow Dropper
cards.card-text:
OFF THE TOP ROPE
COST: Deplete this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: This turn, the character cannot block.
cards.flavor: i can't believe it!  that's gotta hurt! "Illegal, Mean Jean!

cards.name: Explosive Fury
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character you control. X is its strength. Destroy it. Pick another character.

EFFECT: Inflict X damage to the character.
cards.flavor: a spontaneous event Warning: dragon juice may cause indigestion, fever, rage, unexplained weight gain, turgidity, and sudden onset auto-combustion.

cards.name: Eye Gouge
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a blocking character.

EFFECT: Inflict 3 damage to the character.
cards.flavor: less talking, more screaming "Ach! My eyes! The goggles, they do nothing!

cards.name: Flaming Barduse
cards.card-text:
COST: You may pick 2 or fewer characters. 

When this card enters play, if you picked characters as part of its cost, inflict up to 2 damage divided however you want to those characters.
cards.flavor: harbinger of sticky, burning doom In a state of supreme agitation, the mighty barduse vomits a sticky, viscous mess which bursts into a white-hot flame, consuming everything it touches.

cards.name: Fleshripping Scenepuller
cards.card-text: If this card is blocked, this turn it gains 4 strength for each member in the opposing party.
cards.flavor: his face?  i didn't like it. He'll beat you to death, eat your flesh, and sew your skin into his clothing. And if you're very, very lucky, he'll do it in that order.

cards.name: Gore Engine
cards.card-text:
If a character is destroyed during a turn when this card damaged it, put X tokens on this card, where X is the strength of that character.

This card gains 1 strength for each token on it.

IMPALE
COST: Pay 2 or remove 2 tokens from this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: This turn, the character must block this card if it can.
cards.flavor: accept no substitutes

cards.name: Hammer Smash
cards.card-text:
COST: Flip a coin. If you win, X is 2. Otherwise, X is 1. Pick X or fewer items.

EFFECT: Destroy the items.
cards.flavor: if your head gets in the way, too bad

cards.name: Heirloom Incinerator
cards.card-text: If this card inflicts damage to a faction, you may pick an item. If you do, destroy it.
cards.flavor: destroyer of ancestry and culture Quit your blubbering old man! You *and* your stuff are going to a better place!

cards.name: Hidden Sniper
cards.card-text:
SHARPSHOOT
COST: Pay 1. Deplete this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: Inflict 1 damage to the character.

cards.name: Humiliating Torture Apparatus
cards.card-text: If a card is depleted, that cards controllers faction loses 1 influence. (Resources dont deplete when used; they attach to your faction.)
cards.flavor: stop smiling, it hurts! Some torturers disguise their identities. They save the cutest costumes for their cruelest atrocities.

cards.name: Menacing Mauler
cards.card-text: If this card is blocked, inflict 1 damage to each member of the blocking party.
cards.flavor: run away!

cards.name: Morale Officer
cards.card-text:
CONVINCE
COST: Deplete this card.
EFFECT: This turn, all your "soldier" characters gain 1 strength.
cards.flavor: brings out the best in his men "And when we're done, I have no doubt you'll embrace the good and truth of our cause.

cards.name: Murderous Commander
cards.card-text:
CUNNING PLAN
COST: Pay 2. Discard a card. Deplete this card.
EFFECT: Inflict 2 damage to your opponent's faction.
cards.flavor: next! "You see killmajigs have a preset kill limit. Knowing their weakness, I sent wave after wave of my own men at them...until they reached their limit and shut down.

cards.name: Needless Beating
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: Inflict 2 damage to the character. If your opponent's faction has 15 influence or less, inflict 1 additional damage to the character. If your opponent's faction has 10 influence or less, inflict 1 damage to each character your opponent controls. If your opponent's faction has 5 influence or less, draw a card.
cards.flavor: a typical Direstock birthday celebration

cards.name: Oversoon Lightfoot
cards.flavor: the battle is *next* Tuesday Early to rise, early to die.

cards.name: Penetrate
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick an attacking character you control.

EFFECT: If the character assigns battle damage to the blocking party during this battle, assign it to the target of the attack instead.
cards.flavor: sometimes a ram is just a ram

cards.name: Pinch
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: Inflict 1 damage to the character.
cards.flavor: i peench Maybe just a little peench?

cards.name: Plodding Brute
cards.flavor: killing at his own pace Large and uncoordinated, the Brutes travel just behind the main army to ensure that survivors wont be overlooked.

cards.name: Rabid Sarume
cards.card-text: When this card enters play, inflict 1 damage to all your opponent's characters.
cards.flavor: bookish and brutal Lets seesarcophyle, sardines ah, here it is. Sarume aaaaaauuuugh!

cards.name: Raging Bask
cards.card-text: While this card is attacking, you may assign its battle damage to the target of the attack instead of the blocking party.
cards.flavor: bloated reptile on a vomitous rampage Basks are theorized to be nothing more than a tiny brain atop a mountain of bile. None have survived to validate this claim.

cards.name: Really Big Barduse
cards.card-text:
COST: You may pick 2 or fewer characters. 

When this card enters play, if you picked characters as part of its cost, inflict up to 5 damage divided however you want to those characters.
cards.flavor: i didn't know you played the ass-trombone! "It's not the random devouring that bothers me. It's the way he plays with them first.

cards.name: Reckless Challenger
cards.card-text: At the end of your turn, if this card started the turn under your control and did not attack this turn, destroy it.
cards.flavor: fearless and foolish I dont care if its one at a time or all togetherIm going to make ALL OF YOU my bitch.

cards.name: Reveille Tower
cards.card-text: All your characters gain 1 strength.
cards.flavor: echoing the anthems of tyranny Its chilling sound slices the morning air like a razor-sharp sword. The eerie melody foreshadows the dawn of a dark age.

cards.name: Rudo Mangod
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Rudolphus

PUNCH
COST: Pay 2. Deplete this card. Pick a character. X is its strength. Y is this cards strength.
EFFECT: Inflict X damage to this card. Inflict Y damage to the character.
cards.flavor: frightful adonis of infamous temperament

cards.name: Ruthless Platoon
cards.card-text:
CANNIBALIZE
COST: Destroy a character you control.
EFFECT: This turn, this card gains 2 strength.
cards.flavor: Bob was tasty for a thin guy "You know most people overlook it, but there's a lot of good meat on the face.

cards.name: Sadistic Colonel
cards.card-text: If your opponent plays a tactic, inflict 2 damage to their faction.
cards.flavor: eeny, meeny, miney, moe Colonel Blastwad always makes inspection a lot of fun!

cards.name: Scout
cards.flavor: omen of the coming horde Only the most disagreeable warriors are chosen to be scouts. They comb the countryside in disguise, searching for riches, women, and easily killed men. A town can only pray that it has less of these things than its neighbors.

cards.name: Shriever Attack
cards.card-text: Inflict 2 damage to all characters.
cards.flavor: theyll creatively assist you in dying I ascended the peak towards Averys Hern. The shear nervy demeanor of the raven shyer filled my soul with a rasher envy. But alas, the sound of the haver syren from Neva Sherry foretold the dangers of these hillsa cancer these shrievers be!  Henry Raves, nailer of The Style

cards.name: Siege Machine
cards.card-text:
BATTERING RAM
COST: Pay 2. Destroy a resource you control.
EFFECT: Your opponent's faction loses 1 influence.
cards.flavor: intimidating weapon of penetration I will not sacrifice this city. Weve made too many compromises already; too many retreats. They invade our fields, and we fall back. They eradicate entire towns, and we fall back. Not again. The line must be drawn *HERE*! This far, *NO FURTHER*! And I will make them pay for what theyve done.

cards.name: Skewer
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Pay X+X. Pick a character.

EFFECT: Inflict X damage to the character.
cards.flavor: everyone gets a turn Eww looks like that one had corn for dinner.

cards.name: Skin Suit
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character you control. X is its strength. Pick a character your opponent controls. Y is its strength.

EFFECT: Inflict X damage to your opponent's character and Y damage to your character simultaneously. If only 1 of the characters is destroyed by this damage, remove it from the game instead. The surviving character gains all rules text of the removed character.
cards.flavor: wear it while its wet

cards.name: Splattergun
cards.card-text:
UNLOAD
COST: Deplete this card. Pick a character or faction.
EFFECT: Inflict 3 damage to the character or faction. Your opponent takes control of this card.
cards.flavor: the room looks better in red

cards.name: Stalwart Soldier
cards.flavor: rejecting the moral decay of his brethren It was early winter when I went forth from my home base. After many months I found a cave containing tropical coconuts. Using these I fashioned a crude hovel and lived in it for several days. Soon I befriended a pack of bears and we traveled east, towards Macaroon. There I took up small odd jobs under the name of Mister Pilkington. But perhaps Ive said too much

cards.name: Suicide Squad
cards.card-text:
ULTIMATE SACRIFICE
COST: X is this card's strength. Destroy this card. Pick a character.
EFFECT: Inflict X damage to the character.
cards.flavor: perhaps today is a good day to die! "...prepare for ramming speed!

cards.name: Tactician Vacation
cards.card-text:
Your opponent cannot respond to this card.

If you played this card in response to a tactic, terminate the tactic. This turn, tactics cannot be played.
cards.flavor: effective immediately In fact, take the rest of the week off too.

cards.name: Target Practice
cards.card-text:
COST: Pick a character.

EFFECT: Inflict 2 damage to the character.
cards.flavor: drunken pastime of the cruel I like to nail em right after they take the first bite. Whammo! Right between the eyes, granny!

cards.name: Thundering Nilpha
cards.card-text: While this card is attacking a location, it gains 1 strength and cannot be blocked.
cards.flavor:
crushing coils of carnage Smashed into pulp, dashed to bloody ribbons on the rocks, spined and impaled, devoured and ingested, boiled alive in the churning belly of the demon.

Good times.

cards.name: Torrential Bleeder
cards.card-text: At the start of your turn, inflict 1 damage to all characters.
cards.flavor: let the death shower begin! "Damn you bleedy buggers! Damn you to hell!

cards.name: Trip Wire
cards.card-text:
COST: Play this only while you are being attacked.

EFFECT: Inflict up to 3 damage divided however you want to the attacking characters.
cards.flavor: always good for a chuckle

cards.name: Trophy Collector
cards.card-text: COST: Play this only if your opponent's faction has 10 influence or less.
cards.flavor: only the finest frankfurters After eight months of beans and hardtack, you dont ask where the meat comes from.

cards.name: Warrior Prodigy
cards.flavor: just a morning workout The most talented fighters are encouraged from a young age. Theyre given all the food they can eat, all the women they can handle, and all the men they can kill.

cards.name: Wyrmfang Deathskull
cards.card-text:
UNIQUE Wyrmfang

If you attack, your opponent picks any number of characters they control. Those characters must block during this battle if they can, and only those characters can block.
cards.flavor: who lives in a pineapple under the sea? WYRM-FANG-DEATH-SKULL!

cards.name: 12 Man Brunch of Doom
cards.card-text:
COST: Choose a number for X. Deplete X characters you control. Pick a character.
